channel.title: Making a gmail account
channel.description:
Well I was trying to make an account with google mail. I managed to do it, but the only option is to have an email address with
example@googlemail.com
But I've seen lots of people with example@gmail.com
I'd prefer having gmail because its shorter and I think it looks nicer. Anybody know why they are not letting me do this?
Thanks

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:18, topic:215372”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=283085.msg2299632#msg2299632 date=1214545482]

Not only that, you could probably send from @gmail.com with POP3, by setting that as your from address (if you use pop3).

^ Untested.

Don’t you mean SMTP, but anyway, I have tested SMTP and that work with any E-mail address, you just need a SMTP server that works for you.
[/quote]

Yes, SMTP sorry.

It will work with anything, but the headers will show that you’ve done it, and spam filters will block you etc.

Since Gmail and Google are on the same servers, I assume you wouldn’t have that problem.[/quote]
Yes the header will showed it, but so long you don’t have extra Spam filters it will go to the inbox, but in Hotmail it will show as unsafe.

Some people can have problem with that their ISP is blocking all SMTP servers except their own.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:17, topic:215372”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=283085.msg2299483#msg2299483 date=1214541683]
Not only that, you could probably send from @gmail.com with POP3, by setting that as your from address (if you use pop3).

^ Untested.
[/quote]
Don’t you mean SMTP, but anyway, I have tested SMTP and that work with any E-mail address, you just need a SMTP server that works for you.[/quote]

Yes, SMTP sorry.

It will work with anything, but the headers will show that you’ve done it, and spam filters will block you etc.

Since Gmail and Google are on the same servers, I assume you wouldn’t have that problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:16, topic:215372”]Not only that, you could probably send from @gmail.com with POP3, by setting that as your from address (if you use pop3).

^ Untested.[/quote]
Don’t you mean SMTP, but anyway, I have tested SMTP and that work with any E-mail address, you just need a SMTP server that works for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:14, topic:215372”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=283085.msg2298564#msg2298564 date=1214514233]

I think if you have @googlemail.com, then @gmail.com will still work for that name… but I’m not 100% sure.

I checked this by the way, and yes, it does work.
[/quote]
Wait I misunderstood that, so if I just made an account
david@googlemail.com

and someone sends an email to
david@gmail.com

I will receive it?

typlz[/quote]

Yes, you will.

I sent an invite to dave@sexydave.co.uk if you need it.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

They had to change to @googlemail.com because there was already a service called gmail.

I think if you have @googlemail.com, then @gmail.com will still work for that name… but I’m not 100% sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a gmail account
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:3, topic:215372”][quote author=Frell link=topic=283085.msg2297608#msg2297608 date=1214459445]
Maybe theres so many gmail users that almost every combination of a name is taken, so the changed it? But i doubt it.

https://www.google.com/accounts/NewAccount?service=mail&continue=http%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2Fe-11-10da90998825ca401d4f8734ddff3e5c-3e0632cbd2ada89db66511793c844688ee70240e&type=2
[/quote]
I really doubt that they ran out of names. Yeah at that link just says "@googlemail.com"[/quote]
The link i posted says @gmail for me =\
